net.tinyos.prowler

Class TestBroadcastNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.tinyos.prowler.Node
      • net.tinyos.prowler.Mica2Node
        • net.tinyos.prowler.TestBroadcastNode

  • public class TestBroadcastNode
extends Mica2Node
    This is a sample application, it shows a way of utilizing the Prowler simulator. This is a broadcast application, where a mote in the middle of the field broadcasts a message which is further broadcasted by all the recepients. Please note that this is not the only way of writing applications, this is just an example.
    Author:
    Gabor Pap, Gyorgy Balogh, Miklos Maroti

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  TestBroadcastNode.BroadcastApplication
      This extension of the Application baseclass does everything we expect from the broadcast application, simply forwards the message once, and that is it.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void display(Display disp)
      Draws a filled circle, which is:
      - blue if the node is sending a message
      - red if the node received a corrupted message
      - green if the node received a message without problems
      - pink if the node sent a message
      - and black as a default
      It also draws a line between mote and its parent, which is another mote who sent the message first to this.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Starts up a simulator with a ROOT in the middle of a 300 by 300 meters field with 1000 motes and runs it in real time mode.

      • Methods inherited from class net.tinyos.prowler.Mica2Node

        generateWaitingTime, getListenerApplication, getTransmissionStrength, isCorrupted, isMessageCorrupted, isReceivable, isReceiving, isSending, isSendingPostponed, isTransmitting, removeListenerApplication, sendMessage, setListenerApplication, setTransmissionStrength

      • Methods inherited from class net.tinyos.prowler.Node

      • display

        public void display(Display disp)
        Draws a filled circle, which is:
        - blue if the node is sending a message
        - red if the node received a corrupted message
        - green if the node received a message without problems
        - pink if the node sent a message
        - and black as a default
        It also draws a line between mote and its parent, which is another mote who sent the message first to this.
        Overrides:
        display in class Node
        Parameters:
